biography.value:
Korreds are secretive creatures that have strong ties to earth and stone. They prefer to keep their own company but occasionally consort with creatures of elemental earth such as galeb duhr. A tribe of korreds gathers weekly to perform ceremonial dances, beating out rhythms on stone with their hooves and clubs. Korreds typically flee from other creatures but become aggressive when they feel insulted or are annoyed by the sounds of mining.

No one knows the ways of stone and earth better than a korred. Korreds can seemingly smell veins of metal and gems. A korred on the surface can feel the rise and fall of bedrock under the earth and where caves are present, and underground it knows pathways through the stone for miles around. Secret doors set into stone are as obvious as windows to a korred.

Korreds have hair all over their bodies, but the hair that grows on their heads is magical. When cut, it transforms into strands of whatever material was used to cut it. Korreds often use iron shears to cut off their hair, then weave the strands together to create iron ropes that they can manipulate or animate. Korreds take great pride in their hair and equally great offense at anyone who attempts to cut it without permission.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse
Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

description.value:
The korred casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

At will: commune with &Reference[nat]{nature} (as an action), meld into stone, stone shape

1/day: Ottoâ€™s irresistible dance

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Stone Camouflage. The korred has advantage on &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} (&Reference[ste]{Stealth}) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The korred has at least one 50-foot-long rope woven out of its hair. The korred commands one such rope within 30 feet of it to move up to 20 feet and entangle a Large or smaller creature that the korred can see. The target must succeed on a [[/save dex 13 format=long]] or become &Reference[grappled]{grappled} by the rope (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[restrained]{restrained}. The korred can use a bonus action to release the target, which is also freed if the korred dies or becomes &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated}. A rope of korred hair has AC 20 and 20 hit points. It regains 1 hit point at the start of each of the korredâ€™s turns while the rope has at least 1 hit point and the korred is alive. If the rope drops to 0 hit points, it is destroyed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Special Notes: as an action.

You briefly become one with &Reference[nat]{nature} and gain knowledge of the surrounding territory. In the outdoors, the spell gives you knowledge of the land within 3 miles of you. In caves and other natural underground settings, the radius is limited to 300 feet. The spell doesn't function where &Reference[nat]{nature} has been replaced by construction, such as in dungeons and towns.

You instantly gain knowledge of up to three facts of your choice about any of the following subjects as they relate to the area:

  • terrain and bodies of water
  • prevalent plants, minerals, animals, or peoples
  • powerful celestials, &Reference[fey]{fey}, fiends, elementals, or &Reference[undead]{undead}
  • influence from other planes of existence
  • buildings


For example, you could determine the location of powerful &Reference[undead]{undead} in the area, the location of major sources of safe drinking water, and the location of any nearby towns.

You step into a stone object or surface large enough to fully contain your body, melding yourself and all the equipment you carry with the stone for the duration. Using your movement, you step into the stone at a point you can touch. Nothing of your presence remains visible or otherwise detectable by nonmagical senses.

While merged with the stone, you can't see what occurs outside it, and any &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) checks you make to hear sounds outside it are made with disadvantage. You remain aware of the passage of time and can cast spells on yourself while merged in the stone. You can use your movement to leave the stone where you entered it, which ends the spell. You otherwise can't move.

Minor physical damage to the stone doesn't harm you, but its partial destruction or a change in its shape (to the extent that you no longer fit within it) expels you and deals 6d6 &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage to you. The stone's complete destruction (or &Reference[trs]{transmutation} into a different substance) expels you and deals 50 &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage to you. If expelled, you fall &Reference[prone]{prone} in an unoccupied space closest to where you first entered.

You touch a stone object of Medium size or smaller or a section of stone no more than 5 feet in any dimension and form it into any shape that suits your purpose. So, for example, you could shape a large rock into a weapon, idol, or coffer, or make a small passage through a wall, as long as the wall is less than 5 feet thick. You could also shape a stone door or its frame to seal the door shut. The object you create can have up to two hinges and a latch, but finer mechanical detail isn't possible.

materials.value: soft clay, which must be worked into roughly the desired shape of the stone object

description.value:
Choose one creature that you can see within range. The target begins a comic dance in place: shuffling, tapping its feet, and capering for the duration. Creatures that can't be &Reference[charmed]{charmed} are immune to this spell.

A dancing creature must use all its movement to dance without leaving its space and has disadvantage on &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throws and attack rolls. While the target is affected by this spell, other creatures have advantage on attack rolls against it. As an action, a dancing creature makes a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw to regain control of itself. On a successful save, the spell ends.

macro.name: Otto's Irresistible Dance
